title: TVO - The Agenda: Singing the Masculinity Blues
description:
[b]TVO - The Agenda with Steve Paikin, November 18 2013: Singing the Masculinity Blues[/b]

Great efforts have been made over the past few decades to rise the status of women. But has the rise of "Girl Power" devalued men?

[b]Singing the Masculinity Blues[/b]

Has what is distinctly male in contemporary Western societies - and our understanding of gender distinctions - taken a back seat to the project of gender equality?

[u]Guests:[/u]

[b]Jordan Peterson[/b] - Professor of Psychology, University of Toronto
	
[b]Adam McPhee[/b] - Board Member, Canadian Alssociation for Equality

[b]Todd Minerson[/b] - Executive Director, White Ribbon Campaign
	
[b]Russell Smith[/b] - Novelist & Columnist, The Globe and Mail

[b]Michael Reist[/b] - Teacher and author

For more information on this episode, including information on the guests and various other resources and links, visit the episode webpage: <a href="
http://theagenda.tvo.org/episode/197194/so-long-mister" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://theagenda.tvo.org/episode/197194/so-long-mister</a>

[b]ABOUT THE SHOW[/b]

[b]TVO - The Agenda with Steve Paikin[/b]

[i]The Agenda with Steve Paikin[/i] is TVO's flagship current affairs program - devoted to exploring the social, political, cultural and economic issues that are changing our world, at home and abroad. The Agenda airs weeknights at 8:00 PM EST on TVO - Canada's largest educational broadcaster.
